title: Blowing snow advisory
text:
A blowing snow advisory was issued by the <a href="National%20Weather%20Service">National Weather Service</a> of the <a href="United%20States">United States</a> when wind driven <a href="snow">snow</a> reduces surface visibility and possibly hampers traveling. <a href="Blowing%20snow">Blowing snow</a> may be falling snow, or snow that has already accumulated but is picked up and blown by strong <a href="wind">wind</a>s. This advisory was discontinued beginning with the 2008–09 winter storm season, replaced by the <a href="winter%20weather%20advisory">winter weather advisory</a> for snow and blowing snow. However, if the storm is judged to be dangerous by local forecasters, a <a href="winter%20storm%20warning">winter storm warning</a> for heavy snow and blowing snow may be issued.
A similar bulletin is issued by <a href="Environment%20Canada">Environment Canada</a>'s <a href="Meteorological%20Service%20of%20Canada">Meteorological Service of Canada</a> but as a <a href="weather%20warning">warning</a>.
